topIssues.title: Migrate All Dependencies and Plugins to Zod v4
topIssues.author: borisudovicic
topIssues.body:
We need to migrate the Eliza monorepo and all plugins from Zod v3 to Zod v4.

* Stan has already initiated \~20–25 PRs across referenced plugins to bump dependencies (core, bootstrap, langchain/ai/vercel, etc.) to the latest compatible Zod v4 versions.
* Some plugins currently have mismatched peer dependencies; migration only works if all packages are upgraded consistently.
* Newer versions of the AI SDK also rely on Zod v4, so all LLM plugins must be updated to the latest ai-sdk.

This migration is a blocking dependency upgrade: partial migration causes runtime and type errors. We need a coordinated effort to upgrade and test the full set of \~40 plugins.

Acceptance Criteria:

* Update package.json in all monorepo packages to depend on zod@^4.
* Update all plugins (bootstrap, sql, LLM plugins, etc.) to use Zod v4 schemas.
* Resolve peer dependency mismatches across packages.
* Upgrade all AI SDK–based packages to versions that use Zod v4.

topIssues.title: Container Billing Logic
topIssues.author: borisudovicic
topIssues.body:
* Add **monthly cron** to deduct container costs (\~$25–35 per user).
* If cron fails → **pause container**, retain for one week, send email → delete after grace period.

topIssues.title: Deprecation of Langchain v0.3 - migrate to langchian-classic or bump version to v1
topIssues.author: skurzyp
topIssues.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
ElizaOS currently uses LangChain v0.3, which is now outdated. The latest release is LangChain v1, and the previous functionality with the same API has been moved to a separate package called langchain-classic. Since LangChain v0.3 and v1 are incompatible, we cannot easily upgrade the LangChain version in our SDK, as ElizaOS depends on the older v0.3 release.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
bumping `langchain` version to v1

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
migtration to `langchain-classic`

**Additional context**

topPRs.title: fix: align server tests with ElizaOS API changes
topPRs.author: odilitime
topPRs.body:
<!-- CURSOR_SUMMARY -->
> [!NOTE]
> Aligns server tests and routers with new ElizaOS interfaces, clarifies plugin auto-injection behavior, and deflakes/modernizes middleware, loader, socket, and utility tests.
> 
> - **Server/API alignment**:
>   - Update `agentExistsMiddleware`, Socket.IO router, Jobs and Agent Runs routers to use `ElizaOS` getters instead of agent maps.
>   - Adjust message flow and log streaming tests to new event/filter semantics.
> - **Plugin loading behavior**:
>   - Clarify that server auto-injects `sql` plugin; bootstrap injection handled at character level; ensure deduping and order expectations.
> - **Test refactors/deflakes**:
>   - Replace heavy `mock.module` with spies and lightweight mocks; remove brittle fs mocks.
>   - Skip flaky/integration suites causing interference (version, DB ops, message bus, agent runs, some jobs tests).
> - **Utilities and middleware**:
>   - Update tests for `authMiddleware`, validation, security headers, rate limits.
>   - Adjust `sanitizeFilename` expectations and `resolvePgliteDir` behavior; strengthen path handling assertions.
> - **Misc**:
>   - Minor type/interface tweaks (e.g., runtime methods) and improved express server boot/teardown in tests.
> 
> <sup>Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit a988400e95a3efe7e9366332d18e83a99429c2f2. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).</sup>
<!-- /CURSOR_SUMMARY -->

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **Bug Fixes**
  * Improved plugin loading flexibility: server now recognizes both short and full bootstrap plugin identifiers during initialization.
  * Enhanced SQL plugin auto-injection and plugin deduplication logic.

* **Refactor**
  * Removed internal loader APIs: `tryLoadFile` and `loadCharacterTryPath` functions are no longer available.
  * Updated core routing infrastructure for improved agent management.
  * Simplified test infrastructure by reducing mock dependencies and improving test reliability across environments.

<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

topPRs.title: feat: improve accepted formats for plugin names in plugin dependencies
topPRs.author: odilitime
topPRs.body:
<!-- CURSOR_SUMMARY -->
> [!NOTE]
> Adds name normalization and enhanced dependency resolution to handle both scoped package names and short names, with deduped queuing and comprehensive tests.
> 
> - **Core (`packages/core/src/plugin.ts`)**
>   - Add `normalizePluginName` to extract short names from scoped packages.
>   - Enhance `resolvePluginDependencies` with a lookup map supporting both scoped (`@scope/plugin-x`) and short (`x`) names; use canonical names for cycle tracking and final ordering.
>   - Add `queueDependency` and update `resolvePluginsImpl` to queue normalized dependencies and avoid duplicates.
>   - Minor log message tweak in browser warning.
> - **Tests (`packages/core/src/__tests__/plugin.test.ts`)**
>   - Add tests for `normalizePluginName` and resolving dependencies using scoped, short, and mixed names, including testDependencies and complex chains.
> 
> <sup>Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit 5ea3546d4aa38128a1d5825ec8138012a7c72796. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).</sup>
<!-- /CURSOR_SUMMARY -->

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **New Features**
  * Added `normalizePluginName()` utility to standardize plugin identifiers across scoped and non-scoped naming conventions.
  * Added `resolvePluginDependencies()` function to resolve plugin dependencies with improved ordering and support for mixed naming conventions.

* **Tests**
  * Expanded test coverage for new plugin utilities, including scoped/non-scoped packages, complex dependency chains, and missing dependency handling.

<sub>✏️ Tip: You can customize this high-level summary in your review settings.</sub>

topPRs.title: fix(server): update MessageBusService integration tests
topPRs.author: standujar
topPRs.body:
# Relates to

Updates to MessageBusService integration tests following architecture changes

# Risks

Low - Test-only changes, no production code modified

# Background

## What does this PR do?

Updates MessageBusService integration tests to align with the current architecture:
- Removes checks for `MESSAGE_RECEIVED` event (no longer emitted)
- Updates tests to verify message validation flow passes before downstream processing
- Removes redundant Metadata Propagation tests (covered by Message Handling tests)

## What kind of change is this?

Bug fixes (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)

# Documentation changes needed?

My changes do not require a change to the project documentation.

# Testing

## Where should a reviewer start?

`packages/server/src/__tests__/integration/message-bus-service.test.ts`

## Detailed testing steps

```bash
cd packages/server
bun test src/__tests__/integration/message-bus-service.test.ts
```

Expected: 12 pass, 0 fail

topPRs.title: fix: migrate from LangChain v0.3 to @langchain/textsplitters v1.0
topPRs.author: 0xbbjoker
topPRs.body:
- Replace langchain dependency with @langchain/textsplitters in @elizaos/core
- Update import from 'langchain/text_splitter' to '@langchain/textsplitters'
- Remove outdated langchain resolutions from plugin starter packages
- Add comprehensive test coverage for splitChunks functionality
- All 89 tests passing with new LangChain v1 integration

This addresses the deprecation of LangChain v0.3 by migrating to the
modular @langchain/textsplitters package which is part of the LangChain v1
ecosystem. The migration maintains full backward compatibility while
reducing bundle size and future-proofing the codebase.

Fixes #6145

https://github.com/elizaOS/eliza/issues/6145#event-20943795877

<!-- CURSOR_SUMMARY -->
---

> [!NOTE]
> Migrates core from langchain/text_splitter to @langchain/textsplitters v1, updates deps, removes plugin langchain resolutions, and expands splitChunks tests.
> 
> - **Core (@elizaos/core)**
>   - **Dependencies**: Add `@langchain/textsplitters@^1.0.0`; remove `langchain`.
>   - **Code**: Switch import in `src/utils.ts` to `@langchain/textsplitters` and use `RecursiveCharacterTextSplitter` in `splitChunks`.
>   - **Tests**: Expand `splitChunks` coverage in `src/__tests__/utils.test.ts` (empty input, overlap behavior, large chunk sizes, v1 splitter validation).
> - **Plugins**
>   - **Starter templates**: Remove `langchain`-related `resolutions/overrides`; retain `zod` resolution only in `packages/plugin-quick-starter` and `packages/plugin-starter`.
> 
> <sup>Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit fa89f69859ea02c64bbab119021ab889174a52d5. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).</sup>
<!-- /CURSOR_SUMMARY -->

topPRs.title: fix: markdown spacing compact
topPRs.author: LinuxIsCool
topPRs.body:
# Relates to Fixes excessive vertical spacing in AI-generated markdown responses in the ElizaOS client UI. # Risks **Low Risk** - Only CSS changes affecting markdown content rendering - Uses well-supported CSS features (Chrome 58+, Firefox 37+, Safari 11.1+, Edge 79+) - No breaking changes to functionality - Fully backward compatible - Simple rollback (revert commit) **Affected areas:** - Client UI markdown rendering (packages/client) - AI response display formatting # Background ## What does this PR do? Fixes excessive vertical spacing in AI-generated markdown responses caused by Streamdown's wrapper `
` elements. Uses CSS `display: contents` to collapse wrapper spacing while preserving all content and functionality. **Key improvements:** - Bullet gaps: 24.5px → 2px (-91%) - List item gaps: 30.5px → 8px (-73%) - Header-to-bullets: 28.5px → 4px (-83%) - List-to-paragraph: 145.5px → 16px (-89%) - **Total spacing error eliminated: 178.5px → 0px** ## What kind of change is this? - ✅ Bug fixes (non-breaking change which fixes an issue) - ✅ Improvements (misc. changes to existing features) # Documentation changes needed? - ✅ My changes do not require a change to the project documentation. The changes are internal CSS improvements with no API or configuration changes. # Testing ## Where should a reviewer start? 1. Review the CSS changes in `packages/client/src/index.css` (lines 184-278) 2. Review the component update in `packages/client/src/components/ai-elements/response.tsx` (line 12) 3. Test the visual improvements in the running client ## Detailed testing steps ### Automated Testing - ✅ Playwright browser automation with pixel-perfect measurements - ✅ Computed style verification - ✅ DOM structure inspection - ✅ All spacing measurements achieved targets with 0.0px error ### Manual Testing Instructions 1. Checkout this branch: ```bash git checkout fix/markdown-spacing-compact ``` 2. Install dependencies and start client: ```bash bun install cd packages/client && bun run dev ``` 3. Open browser to client UI (http://localhost:5173) 4. Start a chat with any agent 5. Ask a question that generates nested lists, for example: - "Explain the key features of this system" - "Create a list view with example data showing nested workflow progress" 6. Verify: - ✅ Compact, readable spacing between list items - ✅ Tight spacing (4px) between headers and their following lists - ✅ No overlapping text - ✅ Proper visual hierarchy maintained - ✅ No console errors - ✅ Smooth scrolling works correctly ### Tested Scenarios - ✅ Complex nested lists (numbered and bulleted) - ✅ Mixed content (paragraphs, lists, headings) - ✅ Scrolling and overflow behavior - ✅ Accessibility (screen reader, keyboard navigation) - ✅ No layout breakage in any scenario ## Screenshots ### Before *Excessive spacing between elements, particularly noticeable in nested lists* ### After *Compact, readable spacing matching design targets and Claude web interface* # Technical Details ## Files Changed - `packages/client/src/index.css` (+109 lines) - `packages/client/src/components/ai-elements/response.tsx` (1 line modified) ## Key Technical Approach Uses CSS `display: contents` to make Streamdown's wrapper divs "transparent" to layout: ```css .markdown-content > div { display: contents !important; } ``` This removes wrapper divs from the box tree while preserving DOM structure and semantics, eliminating the spacing contribution from Tailwind's `space-y-4` class. ## Browser Compatibility | Browser | Version | Status | |---------|---------|--------| | Chrome | 58+ (May 2017) | ✅ Supported | | Firefox | 37+ (March 2015) | ✅ Supported | | Safari | 11.1+ (March 2018) | ✅ Supported | | Edge | 79+ (January 2020) | ✅ Supported | Covers >95% of modern browser users. --- **PR Title:** ``` fix(client): Fix excessive spacing in markdown rendered content ``` **Branch details:** - Base branch: `develop` - Compare branch: `fix/markdown-spacing-compact` (from gaiaaiagent/GAIA)
